trans-unit.source: Manage your StorSimple backup catalog | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage your StorSimple backup catalog | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Explains how to use the StorSimple Manager service Backup Catalog page to list, select, and delete backup sets for a volume.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to use the StorSimple Manager service Backup Catalog page to list, select, and delete backup sets for a volume.

trans-unit.source: Use the StorSimple Manager service to manage your backup catalog
trans-unit.target: Use the StorSimple Manager service to manage your backup catalog

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: The StorSimple Manager service Backup Catalog page displays all the backup sets that are created when manual or automated backups are taken.
trans-unit.target: The StorSimple Manager service Backup Catalog page displays all the backup sets that are created when manual or automated backups are taken.

trans-unit.source: You can use this page to list all the backups for a backup policy or a volume, select or delete backups, or use a backup to restore or clone a volume.
trans-unit.target: You can use this page to list all the backups for a backup policy or a volume, select or delete backups, or use a backup to restore or clone a volume.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial explains how to list, select, and delete a backup set.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial explains how to list, select, and delete a backup set.

trans-unit.source: To learn how to restore your device from backup, go to <link><linkText>Restore your device from a backup set</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn how to restore your device from backup, go to <link><linkText>Restore your device from a backup set</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To learn how to clone a volume, go to <link><linkText>Clone a StorSimple volume</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To learn how to clone a volume, go to <link><linkText>Clone a StorSimple volume</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Backup catalog</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Backup catalog</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The Backup Catalog page provides a query to narrow your backup set selection.
trans-unit.target: The Backup Catalog page provides a query to narrow your backup set selection.

trans-unit.source: You can filter the backup sets that are retrieved, based on the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: You can filter the backup sets that are retrieved, based on the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: Device – The device on which the backup set was created.
trans-unit.target: Device – The device on which the backup set was created.

trans-unit.source: Backup Policy or Volume – The backup policy or volume associated with this backup set.
trans-unit.target: Backup Policy or Volume – The backup policy or volume associated with this backup set.

trans-unit.source: From and To – The date and time range when the backup set was created.
trans-unit.target: From and To – The date and time range when the backup set was created.

trans-unit.source: The filtered backup sets are then tabulated based on the following attributes:
trans-unit.target: The filtered backup sets are then tabulated based on the following attributes:

trans-unit.source: Name – The name of the backup policy or volume associated with the backup set.
trans-unit.target: Name – The name of the backup policy or volume associated with the backup set.

trans-unit.source: Size – The actual size of the backup set.
trans-unit.target: Size – The actual size of the backup set.

trans-unit.source: Created On – The date and time when the backups were created.
trans-unit.target: Created On – The date and time when the backups were created.

trans-unit.source: Type – Backup sets can be local snapshots or cloud snapshots.
trans-unit.target: Type – Backup sets can be local snapshots or cloud snapshots.

trans-unit.source: A local snapshot is a backup of all your volume data stored locally on the device, whereas a cloud snapshot refers to the backup of volume data residing in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: A local snapshot is a backup of all your volume data stored locally on the device, whereas a cloud snapshot refers to the backup of volume data residing in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Local snapshots provide faster access, whereas cloud snapshots are chosen for data resiliency.
trans-unit.target: Local snapshots provide faster access, whereas cloud snapshots are chosen for data resiliency.

trans-unit.source: Initiated By – The backups can be initiated automatically by a schedule or manually by a user.
trans-unit.target: Initiated By – The backups can be initiated automatically by a schedule or manually by a user.

trans-unit.source: You can use a backup policy to schedule backups.
trans-unit.target: You can use a backup policy to schedule backups.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can use the Take backup option to take an interactive backup.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, you can use the Take backup option to take an interactive backup.

trans-unit.source: List backup sets for a volume
trans-unit.target: List backup sets for a volume

trans-unit.source: Complete the following steps to list all the backups for a volume.
trans-unit.target: Complete the following steps to list all the backups for a volume.

trans-unit.source: To list backup sets
trans-unit.target: To list backup sets

trans-unit.source: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click the Backup catalog tab.
trans-unit.target: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click the Backup catalog tab.

trans-unit.source: Filter the selections as follows:
trans-unit.target: Filter the selections as follows:

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate device.
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate device.

trans-unit.source: In the drop-down list, choose a volume to view the corresponding the backups.
trans-unit.target: In the drop-down list, choose a volume to view the corresponding the backups.

trans-unit.source: Specify the time range.
trans-unit.target: Specify the time range.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText> to execute this query.
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText> to execute this query.

trans-unit.source: The backups associated with the selected volume should appear in the list of backup sets.
trans-unit.target: The backups associated with the selected volume should appear in the list of backup sets.

trans-unit.source: Select a backup set
trans-unit.target: Select a backup set

trans-unit.source: Complete the following steps to select a backup set for a volume or backup policy.
trans-unit.target: Complete the following steps to select a backup set for a volume or backup policy.

trans-unit.source: To select a backup set
trans-unit.target: To select a backup set

trans-unit.source: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click the Backup catalog tab.
trans-unit.target: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click the Backup catalog tab.

trans-unit.source: Filter the selections as follows:
trans-unit.target: Filter the selections as follows:

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate device.
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate device.

trans-unit.source: In the drop-down list, choose the volume or backup policy for the backup that you wish to select.
trans-unit.target: In the drop-down list, choose the volume or backup policy for the backup that you wish to select.

trans-unit.source: Specify the time range.
trans-unit.target: Specify the time range.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText> to execute this query.
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText> to execute this query.

trans-unit.source: The backups associated with the selected volume or backup policy should appear in the list of backup sets.
trans-unit.target: The backups associated with the selected volume or backup policy should appear in the list of backup sets.

trans-unit.source: Select and expand a backup set.
trans-unit.target: Select and expand a backup set.

trans-unit.source: The Restore and Delete options are displayed at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: The Restore and Delete options are displayed at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: You can perform either of these actions on the backup set that you selected.
trans-unit.target: You can perform either of these actions on the backup set that you selected.

trans-unit.source: Delete a backup set
trans-unit.target: Delete a backup set

trans-unit.source: Delete a backup when you no longer wish to retain the data associated with it.
trans-unit.target: Delete a backup when you no longer wish to retain the data associated with it.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to delete a backup set.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to delete a backup set.

trans-unit.source: To delete a backup set
trans-unit.target: To delete a backup set

trans-unit.source: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click the Backup Catalog tab.
trans-unit.target: On the StorSimple Manager service page, click the Backup Catalog tab.

trans-unit.source: Filter the selections as follows:
trans-unit.target: Filter the selections as follows:

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate device.
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate device.

trans-unit.source: In the drop-down list, choose the volume or backup policy for the backup that you wish to select.
trans-unit.target: In the drop-down list, choose the volume or backup policy for the backup that you wish to select.

trans-unit.source: Specify the time range.
trans-unit.target: Specify the time range.

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText> to execute this query.
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon <linkText>Check icon</linkText> to execute this query.

trans-unit.source: The backups associated with the selected volume or backup policy should appear in the list of backup sets.
trans-unit.target: The backups associated with the selected volume or backup policy should appear in the list of backup sets.

trans-unit.source: Select and expand a backup set.
trans-unit.target: Select and expand a backup set.

trans-unit.source: The Restore and Delete options are displayed at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: The Restore and Delete options are displayed at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Click Delete.
trans-unit.target: Click Delete.

trans-unit.source: You will be notified when the deletion is in progress and when it has successfully finished.
trans-unit.target: You will be notified when the deletion is in progress and when it has successfully finished.

trans-unit.source: After the deletion is done, refresh the query on this page.
trans-unit.target: After the deletion is done, refresh the query on this page.

trans-unit.source: The deleted backup set will no longer appear in the list of backup sets.
trans-unit.target: The deleted backup set will no longer appear in the list of backup sets.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the backup catalog to <link><linkText>restore your device from a backup set</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the backup catalog to <link><linkText>restore your device from a backup set</linkText><title></title></link>.
